Title: Hunger
Taglines: An odyssey, in which the smallest gestures become epic and when the body is the last resource for protest.
Production_Co: Film4, Channel Four Film, Northern Ireland Screen
Trivia: First theatrical film directed by Steve McQueen. See more »
Goofs: Raymond Lohan's Ford Granada is a Mk2 Facelift, which was released in winter 1981 and would've appeared on Irish roads in 1982. See more »
Cast: Stuart Graham, Laine Megaw, Brian Milligan, Liam McMahon, Karen Hassan, Michael Fassbender, Frank McCusker, Lalor Roddy, Helen Madden, Des McAleer, Geoff Gatt, Rory Mullen, Ben Peel, Helena Bereen, Paddy Jenkins
Plot: Irish republican Bobby Sands leads the inmates of a Northern Irish prison in a hunger strike. Hunger follows life in the Maze Prison, Northern Ireland with an interpretation of the highly emotive events surrounding the 1981 IRA Hunger Strike, led by Bobby Sands. With an epic eye for detail, the film provides a timely exploration of what happens when body and mind are pushed to the uttermost limit. Written by Icon
Keywords: prison, hunger strike, bobby sands, ireland, ira
Actors: Stuart Graham, Laine Megaw, Brian Milligan
Description: Directed by Steve McQueen.  With Stuart Graham, Laine Megaw, Brian Milligan, Liam McMahon. Irish republican Bobby Sands leads the inmates of a Northern Irish prison in a hunger strike.
